Incident.Summary: Prohibited person possibly in possession of firearms.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: On May 24, 2023, Cpl. Jackson of the Maryland State Police Gun Enforcement Unit was contacted by Parole and Probation Agent Susan German. Agent German advised she has just begun to supervise Donald Edward Doyle W/M DOB: 2-241995. Doyle is currently on probation for 2nd Degree Assault. Agent German advised one of the conditions of his probation is for his grandmother not to have any firearms on her property while Doyle visit/work at her farm. Agent German advised Doyle and his grandmother Geneva Meeks were being uncooperative. Mrs. Meeks advised her the firearms were moved to another property where Doyle does not have access. Agent German requested the assistance of the Maryland State Police Gun Enforcement Unit with keeping Doyle in compliance with the conditions of his probation. On June 1, 2023, Cpl. Jackson conducted a check on Doyle through MAFSS. The check revealed one firearm registered. A check through LinX revealed the firearm was seized by the Carroll County Sheriffs Department. On June 6, 2023, Sgt. Feltman and Cpl. Jackson responded to Doyles residence located at 2203 Blacks School House Road Taneytown, Maryland. Upon arrival Doyle ws contacted and advised the nature of the visit. Cpl. Jackson inquired if Doyle was currently in possession of any firearms. Doyle advised no. Cpl. Jackon asked Doyle if his grandmother Mrs. Meeks was home at her residence. He advised she should be. Doyle provided investigators with directions to her residence. Prior to leaving Cpl. Jackson advised Doyle of his prohibited status. Doyle advised investigators Dep. Patrick of the Carroll County Sheriffs Department was at his residence a few days prior asking the same questions. On this date Sgt. Feltman and Cpl. Jackson responded to 4800 Arters Mill Road Taneytown, Maryland. Upon arrival Geneva Meeks the grandmother of Doyle was contacted. Mrs. Meeks was advised the nature of the visit. Meeks invited investigators into her residence. Cpl. Jackson inquired if there were any firearms on the property. Meeks advised no. She advised the firearms had been removed from the property, so her grandson didnt get in trouble with his probation agent. Meeks advised a deputy from the Sheriffs Depart was just at her residence about the same thing. Cpl. Jackson asked if her grandson possessed any firearms. She advised no. Cpl. Jackson advised Agent German of their findings. Case closed.
